qas.question: What prevented the departure of the planned 1205 expedition?

answers.text: to counter a threat to Gascony from Alfonso VIII of Castile

context: <a0_0>Baronial unrest in England<a0_0/> prevented the departure of the planned 1205 expedition, and only a smaller force under William Longespée deployed to Poitou. In <a1_0>1206<a1_0/> John departed for Poitou himself, but was forced to divert south <a2_0>to counter a threat to Gascony from Alfonso VIII of Castile<a2_0/>. After a successful campaign against Alfonso, John headed north again, taking the city of Angers. Philip moved south <a3_0>to meet John<a3_0/>; the year's campaigning ended in stalemate and a two-year truce was made between the two rulers.
